\n To get your API Key:\n 1. Log i:
To get your API Key:
    1. Log in to your Aidbase dashboard.
    2. Navigate to **Settings** in the sidebar.
    3. Click on the **API** section.
    4. Generate and copy your new API Key.
Adds a YouTube video URL as knowledge to: Adds a YouTube video URL as knowledge to the Aidbase knowledge base.
Adds a website URL as a knowledge source: Adds a website URL as a knowledge source for Aidbase.
Adds a new question/answer item to an ex: Adds a new question/answer item to an existing FAQ; supports categories.
Creates a new FAQ entry with title and d: Creates a new FAQ entry with title and description.
Generates an AI chatbot reply given a me: Generates an AI chatbot reply given a message and optional session context.
Starts a training job on an existing kno: Starts a training job on an existing knowledge base item (FAQ, website, video, etc.).
Make a custom API call to a specific end: Make a custom API call to a specific endpoint
Question: Question
Title: Title
The URL of the YouTube video to add as a: The URL of the YouTube video to add as a knowledge source.
The URL of the website to add as a knowl: The URL of the website to add as a knowledge source (e.g., https://www.example.com).
Select the FAQ to which the item will be: Select the FAQ to which the item will be added.
An optional URL for the source of the in: An optional URL for the source of the information.
A list of category names. New categories: A list of category names. New categories will be created if they do not exist.
The title of the new FAQ knowledge base.
An optional description for the FAQ.
Select the chatbot that will generate th: Select the chatbot that will generate the reply.
The message or question to send to the c: The message or question to send to the chatbot.
An optional session ID to maintain conve: An optional session ID to maintain conversation context. If omitted, a new conversation will start.
Select the knowledge item to train.
Authorization headers are injected autom: Authorization headers are injected automatically from your connection.
Enable for files like PDFs, images, etc..
HEAD: HEAD
Fires when a new email is received in an: Fires when a new email is received in an Aidbase inbox.
Fires when the status of an email change: Fires when the status of an email changes.
Fires when an email’s priority is change: Fires when an email’s priority is changed.
Fires when an email is sent from Aidbase: Fires when an email is sent from Aidbase.
Fires when a new ticket is created in Ai: Fires when a new ticket is created in Aidbase.
Fires when the priority of an existing t: Fires when the priority of an existing ticket changes.
Fires when a ticket’s overall status cha: Fires when a ticket’s overall status changes.
Fires when a new comment is added to an: Fires when a new comment is added to an existing ticket.
Select the email inbox to watch. Leave b: Select the email inbox to watch. Leave blank to trigger for all inboxes.
Select the status to trigger on. Leave b: Select the status to trigger on. Leave blank to trigger for any status change.
Select the priority to trigger on. Leave: Select the priority to trigger on. Leave blank to trigger for any priority change.
Select the ticket form to watch. Leave b: Select the ticket form to watch. Leave blank to trigger for all forms.
Select the type of commenter to trigger: Select the type of commenter to trigger on. Leave blank for all comments.
